fokus 0.0.9011
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • FOKUS questionnaire schema

Extract questionnaire item field value

Source: R/fokus.gen.R
q_item_val.Rd

Extracts a single questionnaire item field value for every first- for every second-level iterator from the raw FOKUS questionnaire data based on the specified variable name and branch path.

q_item_val(
  ballot_date = ballot_dates,
  canton = cantons,
  branch_path,
  v_name,
  key = q_item_keys$key,
  lvl = "?",
  i = "?",
  j = NA_integer_
)

Arguments

ballot_date

A valid FOKUS-covered cantonal ballot date. One of

  • "2018-09-23"

  • "2018-11-25"

  • "2019-10-20"

  • "2020-09-27"

  • "2020-10-18"

  • "2021-11-28"
canton

A valid FOKUS canton. One of

  • "aargau"
branch_path

Sequence of questionnaire table levels that lead to the item leaf node where v_name is defined. A character vector.
v_name

Variable name, without resolved string interpolation, i.e. 1:1 as stated in the raw FOKUS questionnaire data. A character scalar.
key

Questionnaire item key. One of

  • "lvl"

  • "i"

  • "j"

  • "block"

  • "variable_name"

  • "who"

  • "topic"

  • "question"

  • "question_common"

  • "variable_label"

  • "variable_label_common"

  • "response_options"

  • "variable_values"

  • "value_labels"

  • "value_scale"

  • "multiple_answers_allowed"

  • "randomize_response_options"

  • "ballot_types"

  • "include"
i

First-level loop iterator that can be referred to in field value via string interpolation. A character vector.
j

Second-level loop iterator that can be referred to in field value via string interpolation. A character vector.

Value

A vector of the resolved item field values. Type and length resolved values depend on key.

Details

When used in questionnaire item field values via string interpolation, be careful to not create infinite loops via circular references.

See also

Other questionnaire-internal functions q_parties(), q_response_option_codes(), q_response_options()

Examples

fokus:::q_item_val(ballot_date = "2018-09-23",
                   canton = "aargau",
                   branch_path = c("03_proposal_specific", "004_participants"),
                   v_name = "appeal_federal_proposals",
                   key = "include")

#> [1] TRUE

fokus:::q_item_val(
  ballot_date = "2019-10-20",
  canton = "aargau",
  branch_path = c("02_political_start", "002_non_participation",
                  "003_election", "z01_hypothetical"),
  v_name = "hypothetical_voting_decision_federal_majoritarian_election_{i}_seat_{j}",
  key = "topic",
  i = 1:2,
  j = 1:3
)

#> [1] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 1 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 1"
#> [2] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 2 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 1"
#> [3] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 3 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 1"
#> [4] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 1 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 2"
#> [5] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 2 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 2"
#> [6] "Hypothetischer Stimmentscheid Sitz 3 eidgenössische Mehrheitswahl 2"
